body_html:
Hi, I have the same problem (It looks like GPU doesn't release its memory after session.Close() is called, but apparently there are memory available as I can deploy a saved model in my app many times) and tcmalloc doesn't seem to solve the problem. I use Windows and I add tcmalloc library to my visual studio project using the following instruction.
https://github.com/gperftools/gperftools/blob/master/README_windows.txt

Is there anything I can try?
Thank you,

body:
Hi, I have the same problem (It looks like GPU doesn't release its memory after session.Close() is called, but apparently there are memory available as I can deploy a saved model in my app many times) and tcmalloc doesn't seem to solve the problem. I use Windows and I add tcmalloc library to my visual studio project using the following instruction. 
https://github.com/gperftools/gperftools/blob/master/README_windows.txt

Is there anything I can try?
Thank you,
